definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: I laughed and said he must be imagining things.
sentences.chinese: 我大笑着說他一定是在臆想這些事情。

sentences.english: Maybe it's just a fantasy, emerged from the disordered life.
sentences.chinese: 也許只是個臆想，從雜亂無章的生活裏蹦出的臆想。

sentences.english: Maybe it's just a fantasy, emerged from the disordered life.
sentences.chinese: 也許只是個臆想，從雜亂無章的生活裏蹦出的臆想。

sentences.english: Imaginary problems such as these are usually hiding real ones.
sentences.chinese: 像這樣的臆想的問題通常隱藏真實性的。

sentences.english: This is assuming that the piano was properly prepped prior to delivery.
sentences.chinese: 鋼琴在交貨之前就已經調試良好，這隻能是臆想。

sentences.english: So, those not-so-strong imagines become dreams.
sentences.chinese: 於是，不再強烈的臆想退爲夢境。

sentences.english: And what vaporous birds do you hunt in the sky?
sentences.chinese: 你在空中捕捉的又是哪種臆想中的飛鳥？

sentences.english: Hypochondria is the only illness that I don't have.
sentences.chinese: 臆想症是我唯一沒有得的病。

sentences.english: The figure is not plucked from their imaginations.
sentences.chinese: 這個數字並非來自科學家們的主觀臆想。

sentences.english: Peach drop go rain rolled a drift of the conjecture.
sentences.chinese: 桃花落去，一場雨揉捻了飄蕩的臆想。

sentences.english: Chengdu botanical garden can satisfy your fitness perform all leisurely and nostalgic.
sentences.chinese: 成都植物園能滿足你一切悠適懷古的臆想。

sentences.english: Imagine we were analyzing the consequences of a threat to China's stability and cohesion.
sentences.chinese: 有人臆想我們在分析破壞中國安定團結局面的後果。

sentences.english: I have to admit I had some assumptions as to what these family lodging would look like.
sentences.chinese: 我必須承認我對寄宿家庭的樣子做過臆想和假設。

definition: to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
